articles.author: Michael M. Phillips
articles.title: Oil Workers, Snagged in a Dispute Over a Dictator’s Son’s Yacht, Are Freed After Two Years - WSJ
articles.description: The men, imprisoned in apparent retaliation for a legal dispute involving the ruling family’s yacht and villas in Cape Town, arrived home in South Africa Saturday
articles.content: Equatorial Guineas dictator freed two South African oil workers that his regime had imprisoned for years in apparent retaliation for an unrelated legal dispute involving the ruling familys superyacht… [+404 chars]
